result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Demere Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 3 of the Amended Information:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

The sentence for each of the three counts is the same and are consecutive to each other

  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 11 days (count 1 only) served; Huber privileges for work only .Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

No new arrests
Absolute sobriety
Randum urine and breath tests
No association with any drug users or drug houses
Obtain a GED/HSED
AODA Assessment and any  treatment deemed necessary
Cooperate with a Mental Health Assessment and any treatment deemed necessary
Take prescribed medications as directed
Complete a Cognitive Thinking/Behavior program
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Pay all costas, fees, assessments and surcharges associated with this case during the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement

Appeal rights given

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Amended Information received and filed. Defense waived the reading and requested to proceed with plea hearing.

COUNTS 1, 2 and 3:  THEFT  ss943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a),  939.51(3)(a) (each count)

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea on jury trial date.  The court grants joint request to covert jury date to Plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.   Defendant has pending cases in Waukesha County.  Joint motion for adjournment heard by the Court.  Case set for jury trial for reasons set forth on the record.  Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record.

Case is being reassigned to Judge Brash and removed from the drug calendar.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21  Plea hearing scheduled for 11-25-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  lms

Attorney Patrick T. Earle in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 9/24/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiation; awaiting decision of drug treatment court.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter in the event the defendant is not accepted by Branch 06.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report, received and filed.

Stipulation and Order for Modification of Conditions of Bail, signed and filed.

Upon all records, files, and proceedings herein,

IT IS STIPULATED by and between the parties that the No-Contact Order be modified to allow defendant non-violent contact with Samuel Rogers, Sr. and Shirley Rogers, but prohibiting any discussion of the facts and circumstances of this matter.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Joint request for additional status conference date granted.  Status conference scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defense motion to modify no-contact order heard.  State unable to reach the victims for input.  The Court makes no ruling on defense motion at this time.  The Court requests additional information from the state regarding victims position.  Parties to submit proposed order if victims in support of modification.  Defendant admonished as to Justice Point violation; no further action requested by the state at this time.  Case remains set for Status conference on 8-14-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE BRASH.....
Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant's March 12, 2014 AND March 12, 2014 Justice Point reports reflect a positive drug screen for cocaine.
Atty. Morrisey advised the Court that the defendant is awaiting an in-patient bed to become available at a drug treatment facility.
Statements made.
Court admonished defendant for the positive drug screens and advised him that he is jeopardizing his release on signature bond.
Court allows defendant to remain out of custody on the signature bond.
Case adjourned to the already scheduled Status Conference date on 04-15-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 21, Judge Brash's Court.
JusticePoint Report, reviewed and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Bail motion by the State argued and granted by the Court.  Court AMENDS No Contact Order as follows:
Defendant to have no contact with Shirley R.   AND/OR  her residence   AND/OR  her place of employment

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Dennis P. Murphy, appearing for Megan Carmody, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Samuel Demere Rogers not in court.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/14 2 1:30pm
